headline: Boeing’s 737 MAX Delivery Pace Tells the Truth Earnings Reports Can’t Hide
summary: Forget the earnings. Forget the guidance. Forget whatever Boeing (NYSE:BA)’s CEO promises on the next call. There’s only one number that tells you whether this company thrives or continues as is: 737 MAX deliveries per month. Boeing has over 4,000 MAX jets in backlog. Airlines like United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) and Southwest (NYSE:LUV) are waiting. Each ... Boeing’s 737 MAX Delivery Pace Tells the Truth Earnings Reports Can’t Hide

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider BAE Systems (LSE:BA.) After Multi‑Year Share Price Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether BAE Systems is still reasonably priced or already looking expensive, you are in the right place for a clear, valuation focused look at the stock. The share price closed at £19.74, with a 0.6% decline over the last 7 days, a 15.1% gain over 30 days, 12.5% year to date, 66.5% over 1 year and a very large return over 5 years that is close to 4x. Recent news on BAE Systems has centred on its role as a major defence contractor and its exposure to long term government...

headline: Air India Orders 30 Boeing 737 MAX Jets to Expand Single-Aisle Fleet
summary: Boeing [NYSE: BA] and Air India announced today the airline has ordered 30 more fuel-efficient 737 MAX jets, expanding its Boeing order book to nearly 200 airplanes across the company's single-aisle and widebody airplane families.

headline: Boeing’s Profit Return Resets Valuation Questions As Supply Chain Shifts
summary: Boeing reports a return to profitability after a multi year stretch of financial losses. The company moves to acquire Spirit AeroSystems to bring more of its supply chain and manufacturing in house. Boeing increases its focus on production ramp up while advancing work on Sustainable Aviation Fuel with Israel's Technion. Boeing, NYSE:BA, is back in the black, marking a sharp shift from its recent loss making years. The stock trades at $241.59, with a 1 year return of 39.1% and a 5 year...

headline: BAE Systems Wins Key US Contracts As Valuation Still Looks Modest
summary: BAE Systems (LSE:BA.) has secured major new contracts from the U.S. Navy and Army. The deals cover hundreds of MIDS JTRS radio terminals for U.S. and allied forces and new M109A7 Paladin Self-Propelled Howitzer sets for the U.S. Army. These awards expand the company’s role in advanced military communications and armored vehicles. For investors tracking BAE Systems at a share price of about £19.955, these contracts come after a strong run, with the stock up 17.5% over the past month and...
